s.text: The introductory essay reminds readers that a similar list compiled a century ago would not have included Edith Wharton, Theodore Dreiser, Jack London, or Willa Cather because all wrote their best work after age 40.

Forcing miscreants to attend high school is pure folly, based on three untruths: 1) any kid can be taught; 2) dropping out will turn a kid toward crime; and 3) without a high-school education you can't get a decent job.

Time 's enthusiastic package echoes the familiar line about why Bush is the Republican favorite: The breadth of his support among blacks and Hispanics and his landslide re-election victory wowed the GOP.
